basics.name: Jolie Ching
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020.

work.company: UH Manoa Ka Leo O Hawai'i
work.summary: Head of online presence for Ka Leo
highlights: Maintain, update, and oversee official college newspaper website
Refine and develop site’s user experience and interface with BLOX CMS

work.company: American Indian Society and Engineering Society
highlights: Developing a responsive WordPress application through WAMP

work.company: Laboratory of Advanced Visualization and Applications (LAVA Lab)
highlights: Developing a virtual reality visualization of Moloka’i based on Hawaiian cartography in collaboration with the LAVA Lab and Honors Program Director Vernadette Gonzalez and Masters Candidate in Computer Science, Kari Noe
Presented prototypes at the 2019 Lahui Hawai'i Research Conference and annual Native Hawaiian Science and Engineering Mentorship Program

volunteer.organization: Friends of the Hawai'i Kai Library

awards.title: Manoa Regents Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to top 20 incoming freshmen who receive an SAT score of at least 1340, maintain at least a 3.5 GPA in high school, and whose extracurricular achievements are shown to be remarkable

awards.title: Ho’ona’auao Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to high-potential students pursuing undergraduate or graduate STEM degrees

awards.title: Honolulu Panhellenic Alumnae Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to “high schoolers who show a combination of academic achievement, leadership, and community service”

awards.title: National Merit Commended Scholar
awards.summary: Awarded to top 2% of PSAT test-takers in the nation

grants.title: UROP Grant
grants.summary: Project Title: Designing a Virtual Reality Visualization of Hawaiian Geographical Elements
Mentor: Dr. Jason Leigh, Professor of Information & Computer Sciences and Director of LAVA Lab

grants.title: Ku a Kukui Professional Development Grant
grants.summary: Funded He Au Honua conference trip and trips to Keawanui, Moloka’i for Honors thesis project
